    1. apply(Context, Arguments, Options)

Interface Function<R extends Value.Formatted, T>

All Known Subinterfaces:
Function.Implicit<R,T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
DatetimeFunction, NumberFunction, RawFunction, StringFunction
public interface Function<R extends Value.Formatted, T>

This interface models the functions described by project fluent.

A function in general accepts a number of positional arguments (here Arguments ) and a number of named arguments (here Options ) and returns a Result containing either Value.Number and Value.Text.

Implicit Functions

Function.Implicit is a special case, were the function only takes one positional argument, the "value". This special sort of function is automatically applied if any of the variables match (or can be converted via proteus to) a class specified in Function.Implicit.acceptableTypes().

    Interface
    Description
    static interface 
    Function.Implicit<R extends Value.Formatted, T>
    An implicit function is a special case of a function, that can be automatically applied to a certain variable based on the variables type (class).

    • apply

      Result<R> apply(Context context, Arguments<T> arguments, Options options) throws FunctionException
      Applies this function to the provided value and options.
      Parameters:
      context - information like the locale
      arguments - the positional arguments of this function
      options - the named arguments/options to "configure" this function
      Throws:
      FunctionException
